newsitem.title: UK: Eurotherm up as report sparks bid talk.
newsitem.headline: Eurotherm up as report sparks bid talk.

text.p: Shares in Eurotherm Plc rose on Tuesday after a report in the Sunday Times said bidders were circling around the electronic equipment maker after a recent slump in its share price.
As London share trading resumed after Monday's public holiday, Eurotherm shares were up 22p at 408-1/2 by 0842 GMT in thin trade of just 35,092 shares.

The Sunday Times pointed out that the stock had on Friday fallen to its lowest level in two years and said a "number of suitors" were though to have eyed the company but had previously been deterred by its stock market valuation.
It quoted unnamed analysts as saying the company could be open to a bid if a deal worth over 500p per share could be secured.
A spokeswoman for Eurotherm declined comment on the report.
Eurotherm shares have been under pressure for months due to the strength of sterling and a slowdown in profit growth.
Last December the company posted a 10 percent rise in annual pre-tax profit to 37.7 million stg, below analysts' expectations, which were mostly in a range between 38 million stg and 40 million.
